episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the naming of children after service stations, the history of a popular illegal jazz music book, the comparison of a long water slide to a short river, and the development of an Antarctic accent among scientists. The hosts delve into these facts with humor and curiosity, exploring the quirky and unexpected details behind each story.

facts.fact: The founder of the UK's first electric vehicle forecourt was named after a service station.
From 1975 to 2004, it was illegal to buy the world's most popular collection of jazz music.
The world's longest water slide is almost 20 times longer than the world's shortest river.
Scientists in the South Pole are starting to speak with an Antarctic accent.
